name: cheating
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
cheat
B2 [ I or T ] to behave in a dishonest way in order to get what you want: Anyone caught cheating will be immediately disqualified from the exam. He cheats at cards? She cheated in the test by copying from the boy in front. I suspect he cheats on his taxes (= avoids paying as much tax as he should). They cheat people by charging too much for building materials.

[ I ] informal to have a secret sexual relationship with someone who is not your husband, wife, or usual sexual partner: She found out that he'd been cheating on her. I've been cheated on before, and it's awful. I love my wife and I would never cheat. What would you do if you caught your partner cheating?
